Topic.Title: Short Interest as of 3/28/13

Message.Msg: Here is what I can't figure out. Every time LLF has dumped shares on a secondary, the buyers come in and soak it up. Every time the price continues to drop an additional +/- 10%, so why doesn't this "smart" money just wait and buy on the open market at a discount. In essence, the secondary buyers bail out KG time and time again and take additional losses for doing so. There were 27.5 mil shares put out so if shorts covered 5miil or so at $11.23, then who were the other 22 mil?

Topic.Title: Short Interest as of 3/28/13

Message.Msg: i suspect LLF has been hedged the whole time. and the buyers that bail out LLF on each secondary - are his own darn cronies that get him out of his short/hedge position. Then the new shorts enter after LLF has announced his secondary - and push it down. i also suspect LLF's strategies required a healthy subscriber base to his secondary offerings. He probably had hedges on hedges and price control was more than beneficial.

Topic.Title: Short Interest as of 3/28/13

Message.Msg: Without going back and looking at SI each period, that theory does not really make sense. The short interest has grown as the stock price has gone up. Therefore, the shorts entered sales lower and thus a cover would mean taking a loss at a higher price. I do see a pattern however, before each secondary is announced, the price of the stock has gone much higher and then gets gutted as the secondary is announced. That would tell me that shorts are covering into the secondary announcement to drive the price up so LLF will get a better price on his offering. That could well mean, LLF takes a short position lower and then covers to drive the price higher and then sell secondaries to bag holders at a price higher than he would get in a "normal" market. If he takes a loss on say 5 million shares short, he more than makes up for that loss with getting a higher price for the 27.5 million shares he sells to funds.....

Message.Title: What Harry really said:
Message.Msg: You dummies need to read carefully, these are politicians and careless journalists looking for a sensational story that the public must deal with for their info. ______ "“His poor father must be so embarrassed about his son,” Reid said in reference to George Romney’s decision to turn over 12 years of tax returns when he ran for president in 1968. Reid suggested that Romney’s decision to withhold tax information would bar him from ever earning Senate confirmation to a Cabinet post. Then, Reid recalled a phone call his office received about a month ago from “a person who had invested with Bain Capital,” according to The Huffington Post. Reid said the person told him: “Harry, he didn’t pay any taxes for 10 years.” “He didn’t pay taxes for 10 years! Now, do I know that that’s true? Well, I’m not certain,” Reid told HuffPo. “But obviously he can’t release those tax returns. How would it look?” Neither Reid nor his aides would identify the alleged investor, HuffPo reported."

Topic.Title: Senators were told Iraqi weapons could hit U.S.

Message.Msg: 100% baseless assumption is that Romney "didn't pay any taxes for 10 years". Tax filing was and is between individual and IRS. Tax form public disclosure is voluntary act of an individual. It isn't prerequisite for presidential campaign run. Yes, Mitt has something to hide. Like exactly to whom he donated his money, investment details, in which financial institutions he held his funds. All of which are in compliance with tax laws. If he decided not to disclose more forms, that means he gave that to public discretion. He didn't want to open any more lingerie to the media to salivate on. He loses campaign because of that? So be it. But there was nothing improper from law standpoint. Reid's claim is something else. Romney not paying "any taxes for 10 years" is accusation in illegality. He criminalized presidential candidate with 0 arguments to support the claim. A public official making criminal allegations against another individual must be qualified as felony. George Zimmerman filed the lawsuit against NBC for doctoring voice recording which made him look like a racist. Rightly so. But Mitt decided to forget it. It isn't about Mitt. It is about Harry Reid who is a felon with demented look remaining in power. Congrats. He is one of the leaders of your party.

Topic.Title: Senators were told Iraqi weapons could hit U.S.

Message.Msg: Listen, he knew when he ran that most presidential candidates make their forms public. many have all the same concerns as he did, but STILL make them public. If true then Reid was correct. Bottom line, he would need to PROVE to a court that Reid was wrong, but maybe he couldn't, and THAT is why their is no trial.
